title: Congress Opens Boeing MAX Hearing Looking to Toughen Oversight
text:
WASHINGTON—U.S. lawmakers kicked off two consecutive days of hearings Tuesday on what went wrong with Boeing Co.’s 737 MAX jet, with many already looking to tighten federal oversight of how jetliners are certified.

Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg for the first time is set to face congressional interrogation about a faulty flight-control system that led to dual crashes of the MAX, the company’s best-selling plane, taking a total 346 lives. description: As U.S. lawmakers kick off two consecutive days of hearings on what went wrong with Boeing’s 737 MAX jet, many are considering potential changes to tighten federal oversight of future jetliner certification.
